Both movies offer unique and gripping horror experiences!

I'd highly recommend "Young Frankenstein" if you're looking for a comedic take on the classic horror genre. Mel Brooks, the director and one of the main stars, delivers a hilarious homage to Mary Shelley's original novel. It's a great blend of humor and suspense that should appeal to a broad audience.

If you prefer more action-packed thrills with a political twist, "The Purge: Election Year" might be right up your alley. This film stars Mykelti Williamson and Frank Grillo in an intense story set during a future annual purge event, where all crime is legal for 12 hours. It offers a unique blend of horror and action that could intrigue you.
